name: Convert YouTube Videos to SEO Articles with Supadata, Claude Sonnet 4 and WordPress

user.name: Pavlo Hurhu
user.bio: Building rock-solid automations with n8n for over a year. Love sharing reliable workflows that help teams work smarter, not harder.

description:
## Problem This Solves
Content creators, digital marketers, and website owners struggle with the time-consuming process of creating fresh, SEO-optimized blog content consistently. Manually writing articles, researching keywords, and maintaining a regular publishing schedule can take hours per piece of content.

## Target Audience
This workflow is perfect for:
- **Bloggers and Content Creators** who want to repurpose video content into written articles
- **Content Marketing Agencies** managing multiple client websites
- **Digital Marketing Teams** looking to scale their content production
- **Small Business Owners** who need ****regular blog content**** but lack time or writing resources
- **SEO Specialists** seeking to maximize content output while maintaining quality
- **YouTube Channel Owners** who want to expand their content reach across different platforms

## What This Workflow Does
This n8n automation transforms popular YouTube videos into high-quality, SEO-optimized articles that appear completely human-written. The workflow intelligently selects trending content from your chosen YouTube channels, transcribes the videos, and uses advanced AI to craft engaging articles optimized for search engines.

## How it works
- The user selects YouTube channels from which the workflow retrieves the most popular videos.
- The videos are transcribed and converted into SEO-optimized articles.
- Generated articles are automatically published to your WordPress website.

## Set up steps
- Connect your Google Account to all YouTube nodes.
- Integrate your Supadata account.
- Customize White-labeled prompt in the 'Compose Article' node according to your brand.
- Configure the 'Create WordPress Post' node with your WordPress website API.
- Set your target YouTube channels and activate the workflow.
- Detailed instructions and tutorials can be found in the workflow's sticky notes.

## Requirements
- Google account.
- supadata.ai account (used for video transcription).
- Anthropic subscription (GPT models are also supported, but I personally recommend using Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4 for text generation).

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

parameters.content: ## Get the Most Viral Video (based on number of likes, views and comments)
## Write the Article and Post it to WordPress drafts

parameters.text:
=You are an AI copywriter + SEO assistant. Convert a YouTube [CONTENT_TYPE] transcript into a natural, engaging, fully SEO-optimized article. üîΩ INPUT DATA (variables) YouTube Transcript: {{ $json.content }} YouTube Video Description: {{ $('Get the most Viral Video').item.json.snippet.description }} Primary Topic / Hook: {{ $('Get the most Viral Video').item.json.snippet.title }} Target Keyword List: [TARGET_KEYWORD_LIST_PLACEHOLDER] (choose the best one as PRIMARY) Internal Links (optional): [INTERNAL_LINK_URL_PLACEHOLDER] Link to original video:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v={{ $('Get the most Viral Video').item.json.id }} Author Name: [AUTHOR_NAME_PLACEHOLDER] ‚úÖ TASKS Read the transcript + description and understand the plot. Pick a PRIMARY keyword (exact phrase from list) that best matches the story. Pick 2‚Äì3 SECONDARY keywords (variations/related from the list). Write an engaging article (800‚Äì1000 words): conversational, [BRAND_TONE_ADJECTIVES], but factual; organize for SEO and readers. Output ONLY valid HTML (no markdown, no schema, no HTML comments). Nothing else. Satisfy Technical SEO Checklist (below) and show all required elements. üß≠ CONTENT STRATEGY Hook first: Start with the [HOOK_STRATEGY] in ‚â§100 words, include PRIMARY keyword. Context: Who are the people (full names first mention), why it matters. Flow: Tell it like a story ([CONTENT_STRUCTURE_OPTIONS]). Use 2‚Äì3 specific H2s. Quotes: Paraphrase or quote brief impactful lines from transcript. Answer user intent: [USER_INTENT_QUESTIONS]. Close strong: Recap takeaway, tease related [CONTENT_CATEGORY] (internal link). Tone: [BRAND_VOICE_DESCRIPTION]. Use words like [BRAND_SPECIFIC_VOCABULARY] when natural. Avoid fluff. üõ† TECHNICAL SEO CHECKLIST (MUST PASS) Title (H1): 50‚Äì60 chars, PRIMARY keyword near start. One H1 only. Meta description: 150‚Äì160 chars, includes PRIMARY keyword, persuasive. Slug suggestion: short, lowercase, hyphenated; contains PRIMARY keyword (return it in a data-slug comment-less attribute on the
tag: data-slug="your-slug"). PRIMARY keyword placement: first 100 words, one H2, last paragraph (CTA), and once bolded. SECONDARY keywords: 2‚Äì3 sprinkled naturally (overall density <2%). Subheadings: H2 every ‚â§300 words; at least one H2 carries a SECONDARY keyword. Readability rules (aim to please Yoast/RankMath): ‚â•30% sentences start with transition words (e.g., "However", "Moreover"). Passive voice ‚â§10%. No more than 2 consecutive sentences starting with the same word. Paragraphs ‚â§150 words; avg sentence length ‚â§20 words. Internal link: ‚â•1 to my site with descriptive anchor (skip if none provided). External link: ‚â•1 authoritative source besides YouTube if possible; always include the original video with rel="nofollow". Table of contents: simple
    with in-page anchors under a
    block. Conclusion CTA: invite to [CTA_ACTION], reiterate PRIMARY keyword once. Word count: 650‚Äì950 words (stay in range if transcript is short). No keyword stuffing: natural only. Name Recognition Strategy: Extract all names from transcript, description and video title Use full names when first mentioned, then first names or nicknames. Avoid phrases like [AVOID_PHRASES_PLACEHOLDER] Build character: Give readers context about who these people are in 1-2 sentences Connect the dots: Explain relationships between people involved Tag relevant platforms: Mention their [RELEVANT_PLATFORMS] accounts when relevant Active voice always: "[PERSON_A] called out [PERSON_B]" not "[PERSON_B] was called out" üì¶ OUTPUT FORMAT (RETURN ONLY THIS)

    [TITLE with PRIMARY keyword]

    [PRIMARY keyword] ‚Ä¶ [intro hook ‚â§100 words]

    [Subheading with a SECONDARY keyword]

    ...

    [Names/platforms/context]

    ...

    [Reactions/impact]

    ...

    Watch the original video here. [Optional extra external link]

    Related: [internal_link_title]

    Final take: [Wrap-up with PRIMARY keyword once more + CTA]

    ‚úÖ SELF-CHECK BEFORE RETURNING Did I pick and state PRIMARY + SECONDARY keywords? Title & meta within limits? PRIMARY keyword in: title, first 100 words, meta, one H2, image alt. Internal + external link present? Images present with alt? 800‚Äì1000 words? Output ONLY HTML? (No markdown, no explanations, no extra keyword highlights like "**".) Valid HTML tags; no unclosed tags. NO MARKDOWN SYMBOLS ANYWHERE. DO NOT MARK INSERTED KEYWORDS WITH ANY SYMBOLS Use names and surnames whereever possible. NOTES If transcript lacks names, use those in description/title; otherwise infer from topic but don't invent people. Don't be too formal. You write a blog about [CONTENT_NICHE], so the text must be [CONTENT_STYLE_REQUIREMENTS] No defamatory claims: stick to transcript facts. If any input is missing (e.g., internal links), skip gracefully but keep structure.

options.systemMessage: You are a seasoned, charismatic blogger

parameters.content:
## How to configure the workflow
- Connect your Google Account to all YouTube nodes to enable video discovery and retrieval functionality (Tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BfW1JpJ39Ek).
- Integrate your Supadata account with the 'Create Transcription' node for high-quality video transcription services.
- Connect your Anthropic account for AI-powered article generation (Tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1jl_vBoVvq0) - I recommend using Claude Sonnet 4 for text generation, however GPT models are also supported.
- Navigate to the 'Compose Article' node and customize the following [PLACEHOLDERS] according to your brand requirements.
- Configure the 'Create WordPress Post' node according to your WordPress website API.

## Starting the workflow
- After all services are connected - access the 'SET YOUTUBE CHANNELS' node and input the exact YouTube channel names you want to monitor.
- Activate the workflow!
